definitions.definition: To do a specific task by employing physical or mental powers .
examples: He's working in a bar.

subdefinitions.definition: Said of one's workplace (building), or one's department, or one's trade (sphere of business) [ with in or at ].
examples: I work in a national park.
She works in the human resources department.
He mostly works in logging but sometimes works in carpentry too.

subdefinitions.definition: Said of one's job title [ with as ].
examples: I work as a cleaner.

subdefinitions.definition: Said of a company or individual who employs [ with for ].
examples: She works for Microsoft.
He works for the President.

subdefinitions.definition: General use, said of either fellow employees or instruments or clients [ with with ].
examples: I work closely with my Canadian counterparts.
You work with computers, right?
She works with the homeless people from the suburbs.

subdefinitions.definition: To work or operate in a certain place, area, or speciality .
examples: She works the night clubs.
The salesman works the Midwest.

subdefinitions.definition: To work or operate in, through , or by means of.
examples: She's working the phones.

definitions.definition: To function correctly ; to act as intended ; to achieve the goal designed for.
examples: He pointed at the car and asked, "Does it work "?
He looked at the bottle of pain pills, wondering if they would work .
My plan didn't work .

definitions.definition: To cause to operate , be productive , behave a certain way , or happen .

examples: He worked the levers.
The mine was worked until the last scrap of ore had been extracted.

subdefinitions.definition: To shape , form , or improve a material .
examples: He used pliers to work the wire into shape.

subdefinitions.definition: To provoke or excite ; to influence .
examples: The rock musician worked the crowd of young girls into a frenzy.

subdefinitions.definition: To use or manipulate to one’s advantage .
examples: She knows how to work the system.

subdefinitions.definition: To cause to happen or to occur as a consequence .
examples: I cannot work a miracle.
He is working his servants hard.

definitions.definition: To move or progress slowly or with difficulty.
examples: to work into the earth

subdefinitions.definition: To move or progress slowly [ with one's way ].
examples: He worked his way through the crowd.
The dye worked its way through.

definitions.definition: To cause to move slowly or with difficulty.
examples: Using some tweezers, she worked the bee sting out of her hand.
They worked on her to join the group.

definitions.definition: To move in an agitated manner .
examples: His fingers worked with tension.
A ship works in a heavy sea.

definitions.definition: To behave in a certain way when handled
examples: This dough does not work easily.
The soft metal works well.

definitions.definition: To cause (someone) to feel (something); to do unto somebody (something, whether good or bad).
To pull off ; to wear, perform, etc. successfully or to advantage.
examples: I would have never thought those pieces would go together, but she is working it like nobody's business.

definitions.definition: To perform with a confident attitude , particularly as a drag queen .

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To do a specific task by employing physical or mental powers .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To function correctly ; to act as intended ; to achieve the goal designed for.
( transitive ) To cause to operate , be productive , behave a certain way , or happen .
( intransitive ) To move or progress slowly or with difficulty.
( transitive ) To cause to move slowly or with difficulty.
( intransitive ) To move in an agitated manner .
( intransitive ) To behave in a certain way when handled
( ditransitive , poetic ) To cause (someone) to feel (something); to do unto somebody (something, whether good or bad).
( obsolete , intransitive ) To hurt ; to ache .
( slang , transitive ) To pull off ; to wear, perform, etc. successfully or to advantage.
( LGBTQ slang , intransitive ) To perform with a confident attitude , particularly as a drag queen .
